settings.description: Ensures sensitivity labels are created, configured, and published to classify and track CUI location across Microsoft 365 services including SharePoint, OneDrive, Teams, and Exchange
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Sign in to Microsoft Purview portal > Solutions > Information Protection
2. Create sensitivity labels with appropriate CUI classifications (e.g., 'CUI', 'Controlled', 'Sensitive')
3. Configure label settings including scope (Files & emails, Groups & sites)
4. Create and publish label policy to target users/groups
5. Assign admin units if using administrative units in Microsoft Entra ID
6. Allow 24 hours for labels to propagate through services

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Sensitivity labels enable identification and documentation of CUI location by applying persistent classification tags that travel with data across Microsoft 365 services, providing visibility into where CUI is processed and stored
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Identify and document the location of CUI and the system components on which the information is processed and stored

settings.description: Automatically applies sensitivity labels to content containing CUI based on sensitive information types (SITs) and trainable classifiers, ensuring consistent identification and tracking of CUI location
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Navigate to Microsoft Purview portal > Information Protection > Auto-labeling
2. Create new auto-labeling policy for files/emails
3. Define conditions using built-in SITs (SSN, credit cards, etc.) or custom classifiers for CUI patterns
4. Configure detection criteria (All of these / Any of these)
5. Select sensitivity label to apply when conditions are met
6. Choose locations (Exchange, SharePoint, OneDrive)
7. Set policy to simulation mode first, review results, then enable
8. Monitor policy performance and adjust thresholds as needed

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Auto-labeling ensures continuous, automated identification and documentation of CUI across the organization's data estate, eliminating gaps from manual classification and providing real-time visibility into CUI location
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Identify and document the location of CUI and the system components on which the information is processed and stored

settings.displayName: Data Classification Dashboard and Activity Explorer Enabled
settings.description: Provides centralized visibility and reporting on sensitivity label usage, data classification distribution, and CUI location tracking across the Microsoft 365 environment through pre-built dashboards and activity monitoring
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Access Microsoft Purview portal > Data classification > Overview
2. Review top sensitivity labels applied across organization
3. Monitor label activity using Activity Explorer (Solutions > Information Protection > Activity Explorer)
4. Configure alerts for label changes, downgrades, or removals
5. Export reports for audit and compliance documentation
6. Review label distribution by location (SharePoint sites, OneDrive accounts, Exchange mailboxes)
7. Track user adoption and label coverage metrics
8. Schedule regular reviews of classification insights

controlMappings.mappingRationale: The Data Classification Dashboard provides comprehensive reporting and visibility into where CUI resides across the organization, enabling documentation of CUI location and tracking changes to data storage locations
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Document changes to the system or system component location where CUI is processed and stored

settings.displayName: Content Search and eDiscovery for CUI Discovery
settings.description: Enables comprehensive search and discovery of CUI across Microsoft 365 using KQL queries and custom keyword lists to locate, inventory, and document where sensitive information is stored and processed
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Navigate to Microsoft Purview portal > Solutions > Content search
2. Create new content search with descriptive name
3. Define search locations (Exchange, SharePoint, OneDrive, Teams)
4. Build KQL query or use keyword lists to identify CUI patterns
5. Add conditions for sensitivity labels if already applied
6. Run search and review results for CUI locations
7. Export results for documentation and inventory purposes
8. Create retention policies based on CUI locations discovered
9. Document findings including site URLs, mailbox names, file paths

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Content Search provides the capability to actively discover and document the specific locations of CUI across all Microsoft 365 workloads, enabling comprehensive inventory and location tracking as required by the control
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Identify and document the location of CUI and the system components on which the information is processed and stored

settings.displayName: Purview Data Map Scanning for Data Discovery
settings.description: Automatically scans and catalogs data sources including Azure Storage, SQL databases, SharePoint, and on-premises systems to identify, classify, and document where CUI is stored across the hybrid data estate
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Access Microsoft Purview portal > Data Map
2. Register data sources (Azure Storage, SQL, SharePoint, on-premises)
3. Create scan rule sets with CUI classification patterns
4. Configure scan schedules (weekly, monthly) for continuous discovery
5. Enable auto-labeling rules to apply sensitivity labels during scans
6. Review scan results and classification reports in Data Estate Insights
7. Correlate discovered CUI locations with sensitivity labels
8. Export data catalog with CUI location metadata
9. Configure alerts for new CUI discoveries or location changes

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Purview Data Map extends CUI identification and location tracking beyond Microsoft 365 to include Azure, on-premises, and multi-cloud data sources, providing comprehensive documentation of where CUI is processed and stored across the entire data estate
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Identify and document the location of CUI and the system components on which the information is processed and stored; Document changes to the system or system component location where CUI is processed and stored
